question_sentence: A new biography of Keir Starmer reveals that he was beaten up as a teenager while trying to defend an openly gay friend where?
choices: At a Labour Party youth convention
evidence: Starmer told biographer Tom Baldwin thatthe violent run-in occurred at a Cornwall night club in the 1980s. "Keir Starmer: The Biography" includes personal anecdotes about topics ranging from the Labour leader's family relationships to his love of football.

question_sentence: Which actor is suing Disney over their firing from TV series "The Mandalorian"?
evidence: In a lawsuit backed by Elon Musk, the former actor in the "Star Wars" universe is suing Disney and its subsidiary Lucasfilm for discrimination and wrongful termination. Carano alleges she was fired for voicing right-wing opinions on social media and is seeking a court order that would force Lucasfilm to recast her in "The Mandalorian".

question_sentence: Japanese scientists have achieved a world first by creating a satellite made from what?
evidence: Japanese scientists are building the world’s first wooden satellite in an attempt to reduce the pollution of space by metal junk. The LignoSat probe is the size of a coffee mug and is made of magnolia wood, which in experiments carried out on the International Space Station (ISS) was found to be particularly stable and resistant to cracking.

question_sentence: Which country became the first Orthodox Christian nation to legalise same-sex marriage?
evidence: Lawmakers in the<strong> Orthodox Christian country voted by 176 to 76 in favour of legalising same-sex marriage. Under the new legislation, same-sex couples are also nowlegally allowed to adopt children.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court of Alabama ruled that what biological materials are considered "extrauterine children"?
evidence: In a decision that could have implications for reproductive health across the US, the Alabama Supreme Courtruled that frozen embryos created viain-vitro fertilization (IVF)are children, and therefore protected under Alabama state law.The ruling came in response to a wrongful death lawsuit filed after a patient at an Alabama fertility clinic mistakenly dropped a couple's frozen embryos.

question_sentence: Champion equestrian Shane Rose was cleared to continue Olympic preparations after apologising for wearing what at a showjumping event?
choices: A T-shirt with an obscene slogan
evidence: Three-time Olympic medallist Shane Rose briefly stood down from competition after Equestrian Australia (EA) launched an investigation in response to a complaint over his skimpy attire at a showjumping event. For more unusual news, subscribe to ourTall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Director Sam Mendes is to make separate films about each member of which band?
evidence: Oscar-winning filmmaker Mendes will make four separate movies about the band, each telling the story of the Fab Four from a different member's point of view. The films will be financed by Sony Pictures Entertainment and are slated for release in 2027.

question_sentence: Mexican drug cartels are targeting Native American communities in which US state, according to an NBC investigation?
evidence: Mexican drug cartels are specifically targeting the state's six Native American reservations, where "pills can be sold for 20 times the price they get in urban centers closer to the border", according to NBC News.

question_sentence: A newly published German study found that the English language has at least 546 words for what?
evidence: In a recently published study,German linguists found that in Eng­lish, virtually any noun can be transformed into a "drunkonym" – a synonym for intoxication – by adding "ed" at the end. To find out more, listen toThe Week Unwrappedpodcast.

question_sentence: What is the name of the Intuitive Machines spacecraft that landed on the Moon?
evidence: The uncrewed robot lander was built by Houston-based Intuitive Machines with funding from Nasa and is the first US spacecraft to touch down on the Moonsince the space agency ended theApollo programmein 1972.

question_sentence: Which public figure launched a new sneaker line this week?
evidence: Former President Donald Trump unveiled a new sneaker line a day after he and his companies were ordered by a judge to pay nearly $355 million in his New York civil fraud trial. (Image credit: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which state issued flood alerts this week to nearly its entire population?
evidence: Nearly the entire population of California was under flood alerts for several days as a second atmospheric river drenched the state with record rainfall. (Image credit: Josh Edelson/AFP/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which popular racing event occurred this week?
evidence: The Daytona 500, also known as “The Great American Race,” took place in Daytona Beach, Florida, on Monday. Twenty-six-year-old William Byron secured the 11th win of his career. (Image credit: Jared C. Tilton/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Presidents’ Day was celebrated in the US on Monday. The observance usually falls on or near which president’s birthday?
evidence: Presidents’ Day usually falls on or near George Washington’s February 22 birth date. In six states, the holiday is officially known as Washington’s Birthday. (Image credit: Hulton Archive/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which country recently hosted its movie awards show equivalent to the Oscars?
evidence: The 2024 BAFTA Film Awards were presented last Sunday at the Royal Festival Hall in London, England. Christopher Nolan’s nuclear thriller “Oppenheimer” won seven awards, including director, lead actor and the coveted best film award. (Image credit: Chris Jackson/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Former President Jimmy Carter marked one year in hospice care this week, but his family said in a statement that his spirit is “as strong as ever.” How old is Carter?
evidence: Now 99, Jimmy Carter is the oldest living US president in history. His family issued a statement this week celebrating his resolve and expressed gratitude for the support they’ve received through his health battles. (Image credit: Scott Cunningham/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which communications network experienced a widespread outage this week that impacted phone service for customers across the US?
evidence: AT&T acknowledged a major network outage on Thursday that left many US customers unable to place calls, text or access the internet for several hours. (Image credit: Brook Joyner/CNN)

question_sentence: In an unprecedented decision, which state’s Supreme Court this week ruled that frozen embryos are children?
evidence: Alabama’s Supreme Court said frozen embryos are children and those who destroy them can be held liable for wrongful death. Reproductive rights advocates say the ruling could have a chilling effect on infertility treatments and the hundreds of Alabama residents who seek them each year. (Image credit: Lynne Sladky/AP)

question_sentence: What is the minimum age for users on TikTok?
evidence: TikTok says all its users must be at least 13 years old. However, due to some suspected violations, the European Union has launched a formal investigation into whether the platform’s age verification tools are “reasonable, proportionate and effective.” (Image credit: Nhac Nguyen/AFP/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Starbucks debuted an unconventional new latte in select locations that tastes like which of the following?
evidence: In honor of the Lunar New Year, Starbucks has added a “braised pork latte” to its menu at some stores in China. (Image credit: Courtesy Starbucks)

question_sentence: Which conference honored Lauren Park-Lane as the Player of the Year 2023?
What is the primary purpose of the Jamaican Heritage and Reggae Museum Judy Malcolm plans to open in Delaware?
choices: To showcase Bob Marley’s personal belongings and memorabilia.
To promote cultural heritage and awareness of Jamaican history.
To celebrate the contributions of the Jamaican community in Delaware.
To educate visitors about the economic influence of reggae music.

question_sentence: What is the primary goal of the Wilmington Learning Collaborative (WLC)?
choices: To increase teacher recruitment and retention.
To unify a fractured state of public education in Wilmington.
To explore nine schools across Delaware’s largest city.
To hire two more director positions at $125,000 salaries.

question_sentence: Which NBA team did Mac McClung represent when he won the 2023 AT&T Slam Dunk Contest?
Which seafood dish can you find on the menu at Harry’s Savoy Grill?
choices: Broiled jumbo lump crab cakes with bok choy slaw
Pennsylvania trout with bacon sherry beurre blanc

question_sentence: What specific charge was the officer at Delaware’s juvenile lockup near Wilmington indicted for?
A former gas station that sat vacant for years in Odessa has been transformed into what kind of new establishment?
What was the purpose of the recent referendum held in the Brandywine School District?
choices: To invest in school safety boosts

question_sentence: The state Department of Education wants more funding to boost student performance in what area?
Which urban lifestyle golf brand is responsible for the unique T-shirt that Super Bowl MVP Patrick Mahomes was spotted wearing?
